intro: Anagallis arvensis var. lilacina, commonly known as the lilac morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to lilac, often with a white throat. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and along fences. The flowers open in the morning and close by midday, giving it its common name.
